intro: Galium demissum subsp. stojanovii, commonly known as the Stojanov's bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of the Balkans. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its hairy stems and leaves are adapted to retain moisture in its preferred habitat.
